dataList.content: I see the exit over there!
Gah, persistent rotters.
<We’ll have to distract them somehow before we can get away…>
Why don’t you throw one of us at ‘em? You can bring them back later anyway.
Why are you looking at me while you say that?!
<…Hold on, look there…>

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: Leave this to me.
Sonya?! What are you playing at?
<Rodya! What’s with your attitude? We have to take all the help we can get!>
I’ve seen people who’d offer to help without asking for anything, and they’d usually have some ulterior motive.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: It’s just like how you simply couldn’t hold yourself back from using your axe that day.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: I’m discovering that I might have a similarly… inexplicable drive pushing me.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: Dante, I take it that your organization is working to make a better world in its own right, yes?
<I… Uh-huh?>
What does a better world entail?
For the first time, I was reminded that I had never questioned the motivations of Limbus Company.
Thankfully, none of my contemplative fudging reached Sonya, and he took my lack of a response as a sign of agreement.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: Silence sometimes speaks volumes. I’ll take that as a positive.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: And one more thing… That child will soon visit you, too.
<Child?>
Huh?
Ah… Sorry. My eyes must have fooled me. I thought I saw something on his forehead for a second…

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: Indeed, I mean that boy who left quite the impression on you. It’ll be a touching reunion, I imagine.
Sonya nudges his chin at something behind him.
A faint light was shining between the fallen blocks of ice, giving a distinctive glow…
<The Golden Bough…>

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: Don’t expect me to act on the same impulse of kindness next we meet, though.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: If a clear path towards prosperity of the many shows itself before my eyes, I’ll take it without hesitation.
After Sonya left us with a mysterious message, the Yurodiviye began to show up one after the other.
Well… This may have been as good a time as any for touching farewells like “I won’t forget you!”
…Then I saw that Rodya was the first to sprint for the exit.
Rodion. Are you not concerned?
What’s up?
Irrespective of consequential differences, he was nevertheless a friend of yours.
Ah, that~ Eh, he’s a clever sort, so I’m sure he’ll figure out a way to live and all that jazz.
…Truly, an ideal form of friendship.
Sometime later…
Though I was dead tired, Vergilius wouldn’t spare me from his fierce gaze until I gave him a brief verbal report of what we went through today.
…I see, so that’s your story. There’s just one thing that bothers me, though.
This man… Sonya, was it? His actions during those final moments don’t quite seem to match the beliefs he told you.
Which is why we should scrutinize his true intentions…
Hey, time out, tiiime out!!!
First Yi Sang, and now you too? Why does everyone care more about Sonya than me? The bottom line is that we got the Golden Bough.
As a plus… Check this out, everyone~
From her pockets, Rodya pulled out a colorful bunch of gaming chips in her hands.
We can exchange these cuties for cash at any casino, so we should drop by one.
I nabbed ‘em while our manager dazzled the floor with their jackpot.
<I’m impressed that you thought to snatch that stuff amidst all the chaos.>
Well, Verg? What do you say to a juicy serving of prime sirloin steak to celebrate our abounding success today?
…What do you think, Charon?
…Mmm.
Seems Mephi wants it too. Fresh, succulent, juicy meat.
Gah, of all the things you could mention…
Alright, then. I’ll leave Rodion to pick a restaurant in District 10 for us.
Okay. Vroom-vroom.
Now we’re talking, Verg.
After all’s said and done…
Beneath her grin, Rodya’s eyes were shaking with distress, but she soon covers it up with a guise of joviality as if nothing ever happened.
I’m pretty rad, aren’t I?

dataList.title: N Corp.
dataList.content: Impressive, Yurodivy.

dataList.title: N Corp.
dataList.content: Not only did you manage to clear out the legion of foes…

dataList.title: N Corp.
dataList.content: You also burned all that cash.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: You should know, Hermann, that I’ve never been friends with money.

dataList.title: N Corp.
dataList.content: I will admit, you are not like most idealists who are all theory and no action.

dataList.title: N Corp.
dataList.content: You would’ve earned my praise had you secured the Golden Bough on top of everything.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: …I showed Rodya that world.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: The ideal reality that fascinated me.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: Alas…

dataList.title: N Corp.
dataList.content: I suppose it didn’t win her over.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: It seems the method you suggested was wrong after all, Hermann.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: She wasn’t the kind of person to let a few words change her mind.

dataList.title: N Corp.
dataList.content: So, do you find this… regrettable?

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: Well…

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: Part of me might’ve wished that she’d follow me like in the past.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: But no, I think I’m actually relieved to find that she’s the same as before.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: Rodya wasn’t wishing for a perfect world with no flaws whatsoever.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: Rather, she might have felt…

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: That it would be boring to live in such a world, since there’d be no way to affirm that she’s special.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: That’s the impression I got.

dataList.title: N Corp.
dataList.content: I thought her to be a woman of virtue, principles unshakable…

dataList.title: N Corp.
dataList.content: But hearing this, she was a dreamer just like you, wasn’t she?

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: She still has a long way to go, I’m sure.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: …She won’t want to admit it, though.

dataList.title: N Corp.
dataList.content: I got your point. I’ll keep it in mind for future considerations on our course of action.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: You won’t scold me for this? I was unable to complete the job you gave me.

dataList.title: N Corp.
dataList.content: Reprimands won’t make the Bough appear at our feet, will they?

dataList.title: N Corp.
dataList.content: It’s fine. Wherever the Boughs may be right now…

dataList.title: N Corp.
dataList.content: What matters more is who claims the bundle at the end.
